ok.  I've had some success.  I ran cmake-gui and provided the appropriate paths and configured for the native 2015 win64 compiler.  I've done this before with zero luck.  No idea what went differently this time.

Anyway, then, I tried to build the vs project files.  I encountered the following errors:

1.  The linker couldn't find my boost libs for the sdformat project because the lib path wasn't specified under Project Properties -> Linker -> General -> Additional Library Directories.  This was the issue for both Release and Debug.

2. Also, the build fails for the test components.  It can't find "sdformat.dll":

    Error copying file (if different) from "C:/Users/gazebo/gazebo/sdformat/build/src/sdformat.dll" to "C:/Users/gazebo/gazebo/sdformat/build/test/performance/Debug".

This error is generated for the post build event on the integration and performance tests.

After exploring my build results, I see that sdformat.dll is located in C:\Users\gazebo\gazebo\sdformat\build\src\Debug and that sdformat.lib is located in C:\Users\gazebo\gazebo\sdformat\build\src.

The same goes for ign-math3.dll.  Copying both files back one level fixes the problem.  ALL_BUILD succeeds and INSTALL succeeds.
